result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis Sabourin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No contact with victim unless approved by the agent.

Pay supervision fees.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petition for Return of Property mailed to Attorney Mark P. Zmolek. Not enough info provided(to process) in Motion For Sentence Modification & Return of Personal Property previously filed.
Motion for Sentence Modification and Return of Personal Property on cases 15CM2130 and 15CM4100.
Bail Bond Refund Packet
2/11/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.
16A 004668/reapplied.
16A 004661/reversed

Defendant Dennis Sabourin in court with attorney Mark Paul Zmolek.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing...
.
Sentencing continued...
  Statements made as to sentencing. 
As to count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 years, with credit for -0- DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 year; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year, consecutive. 
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS, concurrent with 15CM4100,  with the following conditions:
*   Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*   No contact with victim unless approved by the agent.  
*   Obtain/maintain employment; 
*   Pay supervision fees;
*   Provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge;
*   Pay all remaining costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DV surcharge,  bail to apply, if any, remaining costs and surcharges are to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Dennis Sabourin in court with attorney Mark Paul Zmolek.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for trial today.  Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
Plea hearing continued...
.
As to count 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
.
Defendant has a new case that is in arrest warrant status, 15CM004100.  Defendant was taken into custody in court to clear the warrant.
.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

15RM049976  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
11-07-2015
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court set cash bail in the amount of $3,000 cash. All other terms and conditions of bail remains the same.

Defendant Dennis Sabourin in court with attorney Mark Paul Zmolek.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. At first call parties ready to proceed to trial. Case passed.  Case recalled.  For reasons stated on the record the Court granted the State's request for an adjournment.  Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis Sabourin in court with attorney Mark Paul Zmolek.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense counsel is requesting a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis Sabourin in court, PRO SE.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is NOT eligible for appointment of counsel by court or SPD. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested additional time to retain counsel. Case adjourned to branch 36. Court continued right of substitution to through the end of the next court date.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Status conference scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shekevia J.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (7/11/2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Dennis Sabourin in court. Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
